title: what's up with the Yasuo nerf
body: Not really bothered with the upcoming Yasuo changes tbh. Just wondering why it's a 'nerf' if they lowered the base damage but gave him an additional AD ratio for it.

replies.body: Pretty pathetic change imo his e is fine as it is they need to either do something about his passive shield or his windwall

because to get the 50 damage you lose back, you need to have 250 bonus AD.

{{item:3031}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3156}} - this basically gives him back the damage he had. and only on the inital cast.

If you take into account the stacking passive, instead of 225 damage on 3rd cast, he only does 150 + 0.2 AD. With above items, that would be +50, so 200.
200 < 225

Its a nice nerf to "tank" Yasuo in particular. Also hurts his lane phase too.

yeah though I'm afraid that if he gets nerfed too hard, riot will try to overcompensate to bring him back and personally I find with meta shifts, yasou isn't as dominating as he was in the past at the moment and even when he gets fed, with the right picks, he's still pretty manageable.

They nerfed the early damage so yasuos maxing e first are punished harder than q.
Yasuo is a snowballing champion so it cuts down his early game (also most yasuos take attack speed runes, so it also changes that a bit)

By nerfing the E you force Yasuo to max Q. 
That way, he actually has to use his Q to damage you, and not just E all over the battlefield and win the lane that way.
